snippet: John Adams said he feared that without international exposure via the Met’s cinema program, “The Death of Klinghoffer” might be greeted by a “Wikipedia opinion.”
abstract: Composer John Adams opposes decision by the Metropolitan Opera not to transmit performance of his opera The Death of Klinghoffer to movie theaters around world; controversial opera tells of the murder of a Jewish passenger during 1985 hijacking of an Italian cruise ship; cancellation of screenings was part of compromise with Jewish groups who had opposed the production.
lead_paragraph: John Adams said he feared that without international exposure via the Met’s cinema program, “The Death of Klinghoffer” might be greeted by a “Wikipedia opinion.”
